element.name: TLazAccelerometer
element.short: Represents the hardware accelerometer

element.name: TLazAccelerometer.xaxis
element.short: The last value measured for the X axis of the accelerometer

element.name: TLazAccelerometer.yaxis
element.short: The last value measured for the Y axis of the accelerometer

element.name: TLazAccelerometer.zaxis
element.short: The last value measured for the Z axis of the accelerometer

element.name: TLazAccelerometer.StartReadingAccelerometerData
element.short: Starts monitoring the accelerometer sensor

descr.p: After calling this method, the accelerometer sensor will be monitored. If the accelerometer native API sends an event for value changes, then the event OnSensorChanged will be called on every change and before calling it the xaxis, yaxis and zaxis properties of the Accelerometer global object will be updated to reflect the last value read. If the native accelerometer API requires pooling, then the accelerometer state will be pooled at a rate not faster then once per millisecond.
Remember to call StopReadingAccelerometerData when the accelerometer is no longer needed, because this may save energy in some mobile platforms.

element.name: TLazAccelerometer.StopReadingAccelerometerData
element.short: Stops monitoring the accelerometer sensor

descr.p: After calling this method OnSensorChange will no longer be called and the xaxis, yaxis and zaxis properties will remain stopped at the last value read

element.name: TLazMessaging.SendMessage
element.short: Sends a message to the target specified on it

descr.p: The message to be sent should be created with the method CreateMessage from this same class and later released with FreeMessage. The same message can be sent multiple times, but ideally it should not be edited after sending the first time to avoid confusion when obtaining the message object back in the status callback.

element.name: TLazMessaging.CreateMessage
element.short: Creates a new message which can be sent with SendMessage

element.name: TLazMessaging.FreeMessage
element.short: Removes a message created with CreateMessage
